alert.note: Alert for Lawrence (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 29 at 9:43AM CDT until April 01 at 6:08AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Embarras River at Lawrenceville affecting Lawrence County. .The following forecasts are based on observed precipitation, soil moisture conditions, and forecast precipitation. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Embarras River at Lawrenceville. * WHEN...Until Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 36.0 feet, Billet-Vincennes River road is inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 36.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 AM CDT Wednesday was 36.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 36.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 30.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Embarras River Lawrenceville 30.0 36.0 Wed 7 am CDT 35.4 32.7 29.2 &&
info.instruction: Persons with interests along this river need to prepare for flooding. Stay tuned for further updates on this flooding situation.
